snippet: Representatives of both sides played down the idea that the exchange, long seen as a crucial prelude to any broader talks, might breathe new life into a peace effort.
abstract: Release of five senior Taliban figures in exchange for American soldier Sgt Bowe Bergdahl represents diplomatic first in Afghan war and provides rare glimpse into Taliban's inner workings; exchange is deeply criticized by some Republicans who warn that it will boost Taliban morale and shore up the power of its leadership, while others say it could potentially breathe new life into peace effort.

byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and CARLOTTA GALL
byline.contributor: Matthew Rosenberg reported from Kabul, and Carlotta Gall from London. David E. Sanger and Brian Knowlton contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Representatives of both sides played down the idea that the exchange, long seen as a crucial prelude to any broader talks, might breathe new life into a peace effort.

headline.main: Prisoner Trade Yields Rare View Into the Taliban
headline.print_headline: Prisoner Trade Yields Rare View Into the Taliban
